Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the statewide mask requirements in Mississippi will be abolished at the beginning of October 2020, as confirmed by the Mississippi Emergency Management Agency.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the letter from Mississippi Gov. Tate Reeves, as the letter itself is fake and does not hold any official authority.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fake letter circulating on social media, which has been debunked by the Mississippi Emergency Management Agency.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the letter from the governor is genuine and that the statewide mask requirements will be abolished, without any official announcement or confirmation from the governor.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the letter circulating on social media is fake and does not reflect the official stance of the governor or the state of Mississippi.
